QR Code Link to This Post


What is Pathrise

Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.

Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 500 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.

About the Fellowship

The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.

During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.

Our Mission

We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.

Qualifications

You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice.
You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup.
You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.

Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=bosdata&utm_medium=job_board

Job Title: Co-founder wanted for tech business startup
Job Attributes:
compensation: Equity Stake

employment type: full-time
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Co-founder wanted for tech business startup

Are you a the savvy self starter looking to join/build a startup? Do you have high level skills which you feel under-compensated for, or feel you could be doing more with whether in your spare time or your sole venture? This may be the spot for you!

The Company is in it's infancy, white boards and work flow charts along with extensive internal market research and my own experience. I am seeking specifically a partner who will compliment my shortcomings in the tech side of this venture. I have the vision, the drive, and the finances to fund the launch. The company is a software/HR/supplemental hiring company that will be web based to be used by companies such as Indeed, Careerbuilder and the U.S. government for candidates seeking employment/job surfing. It is designed to bridge a missing link within the hiring process for the private sector. The reason this gap exists is because of the lack the lack of skilled employees in today's market place among virtually all industries. The secondary function relates specifically to unemployment for the government. This platform is designed to save business' and the tax payers both time and huge sums of money. Preliminary numbers from within my industry assume 10-18k per year per company. Larger scale companies such as law and finance stand to save in excess of 30k annually as a result. Billable's for this company are to be generated first by ad traffic, and by annual subscription. With nearly 28 MILLION registered business' in the US, the market for this is very real, and the demand high. I personally struggle with what this problem would solve daily, and a lot of my colleagues agree we have a real problem.  Add to that the nearly 6 MILLION people (which by the way is VERY LOW historically) on unemployment and the vision suddenly transcends my wildest dreams for opportunity.  I'd be willing to explore other avenues of revenue generation outside of the ones I am currently aware of.

I'm not paid to be a founder. Neither will I pay you. But you'll own part of the company, with the additional benefits of:
1) the excitement and satisfaction that comes with being a startup founder
2) the multitudes of priceless skills you'll develop that will be your asset forever
3) the gratification of building something from nothing, for your own company
4) the opportunity to work with and learn from super driven and talented people- whom we will choose together 
5) the deep knowing every day that you're living your highest potential

Qualifications:
Preferred-Proficient - Advanced skills in coding and website design
Preferred- Proficient - Advanced skills in App integration/development
General understanding of google ad-words and Social Media Marketing

The right candidate is:
Independent
Self-starter
Highly motivated
Willing to self-educate
Willing to sign a NDA and Non-Compete
Willing to work unpaid in exchange for equity stake

The job description is vast, and admittedly not fully understood. A candidate looking to operate within a cube with constant direction will not find it here. You have an entrepreneurial drive, a passion for and full understanding of the vision, the ability to work just as well independently as well as part of a team. An understanding of where you are weak so that we can highlight them and ensure we get either 1) the support we need identified upfront, or 2) an area for us both to focus on and self-educate in order to move forward. The ideal candidate is available to commit a minimum 15+ hours per week from home with face to face meetings weekly. Equity stake is based on experience, and results which we will outline clearly.

About me:
Visionary
Seasoned HR and Production and Hiring Manager
Small startup experience (2 small companies non tech)
Marketing and sales experience
Currently employed- this is a side project for me, which I am looking to partner, burn the boats (Kudos if you're up on this reference) and go at this full time. In order for me to do that we need to establish a relationship, and a product with billable's.

What you can expect from me/ this process.

1st interview - by phone. My goal is to gain an understanding about you and what you are looking for and answer the questions that I can for you at this point
2nd interview - by phone. My goal here will be to gain answers to questions from the first phone interview and set up an in-person interview
3rd interview -in Person. Our goal is to see if we click, maybe an activity. You can expect to get a glimpse of the vision and have some small tasks assigned to you as part of the interview process. You can expect to be presented with two documents. 1) a non-disclosure 2) a non-compete
4th interview- in person. Our goal will be to see if the spark is there, is there passion for this vision on your end and understand the core competencies we would have combined and where the shortfalls might be.

At this point I expect to have a couple of candidates from which to review.

Please promptly reply to this ad to set up a time for us to meet along with your resume, education/background, any relevant startup experience and availability to dedicate to this project.

I look forward to speaking with and learning more about you!

Nick

Job Title: Cloud or mobile engineer, side gig, major equity, proven team
Job Attributes:
compensation: Equity only, substantial chunk, no cash

employment type: part-time

telecommuting okay
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


COMPANY
We are an early-stage, stealth-mode, private company headquartered in Austin, Texas. We are looking for the best talent wherever it may exist (within the U.S.). Company leadership is proven and has built/sold several companies in successful exits to the biggest names in tech.

OPPORTUNITY
This is a ground floor opportunity to join and contribute early, take a major equity stake in the company as part of the core team, and keep the safety of your day job and its salary and health benefits. 

• If you want the upside of a major equity stake, you should look at this opportunity.
• If you love music, you should look at this opportunity. 
• If you love developing truly innovative  and fun products, and not just the same old crap, you should look at this opportunity.

We are looking to add one more cloud engineer and one more mobile engineer to our core team, so in exchange for 10-15 hours per week of part-time work (you can keep your day job and its salary), we can offer you an amount of equity that is twice the amount typically granted to a VP of Engineering in a venture-backed startup for full-time work. This is a serious offer, and only highly qualified and serious candidates will be considered.

REQUIREMENTS
• Proficient in developing on the AWS platform/stack
• Proficient in developing in multiple languages
• Proficient in the use of SQL 
• Able to crank out meaningful quantity of high-quality work product in limited time
• Self-motivated, self-organizing, comfortable as part of fully virtual team
• Good human being, no time for a$$holes
• Truly enjoy building cool stuff
• Interested in selling what we build for an M&A exit

On the cloud side, we are using Node.js and various AWS services including Cognito, AppSync, SQS, RDS (PostgreSQL), and S3. On the mobile side, we are using RxSwift for iOS and Android apps.

COMPENSATION
This is a part-time, side-gig position. Initially there is no salary or other cash compensation – it’s equity only. We typically transition the core team (at your option) to full-time and salaried at the Series A round. This opportunity is an excellent one for a very talented individual who has a day job to cover salary requirements, but is interested in not working for a salary for the rest of their life, wants a major equity stake, and values the chance to play a key role in building a significant company.

LOCATION
Candidate must be located in the United States.

APPLICATIONS
No recruiters please. If you are an applicant, please reply to this ad with your resume and a note explaining your interest. We will not reply to all applications, but we do appreciate your interest. We will contact you if you look like a potential match.

Overview:
Talented and committed individuals are the backbone of any business. Government contractor small business seeking just such an individual to join its team as a Software Engineer. We have a history of developing innovative technology solutions for government projects and would like to invite you to collaborate with us in making a real-world impact. 

Specialties cover a wide variety of areas, including modeling and simulation, artificial intelligence, gaming-related technologies, network support, 3D modeling, web development, mobile application development, and data analysis and management solutions. Please see the following responsibilities and qualifications to learn more about your prospective position.

Role and Responsibilities
Software Engineer will:
•	Work on a broad range of projects, across many domains. The ability to understand a problem space, learn new technologies and disciplines, and apply your expertise to find a solution is of paramount importance. Although using C++ or C# in a Visual Studio environment is most common, we have used many other technologies when they were the appropriate tool for the job (e.g. Python, Java, AngularJS, ASP.NET, Qt, MySQL, SQLite, Windows, Linux, and Android).
•	Work closely with senior members of the team, initially taking on smaller scale tasks, working towards ownership of components, systems, and eventually projects.
•	Apply well thought out designs to the software you write using best practices for object-oriented and functional programming, database design, user interaction and UI design.
•	Apply processes and tools to streamline and support the development process. This includes using distributed source control (we use mercurial), automated build processes, and bug tracking software.
•	Work in a collaborative environment where employees are encouraged to learn new skills, help each other, and actively participate in improving the company.

Qualifications:
·U.S. citizenship required due to Government contract requirements
·B.S. in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience; Masters or above is a plus
·2 - 5 years experience

Job Title: Data Migration Specialist - Oracle & SQL Server
Job Attributes:
compensation: Hourly, Depends On Experience

employment type: contract
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are a small, well-established company seeking a qualified candidate to assist with our Oracle to SQL Server migrations for our customers on a project and/or hourly basis. The majority of our customers have in-house DBA staff who will take joint ownership of the migration projects, although there may be exceptions. 

Experience/qualifications:

Hands-on experience using SQL Server Migration Assistant for Oracle (SSMA)
Experience working with MS SQL Server 2014, 2016, including ability to write, edit and debug SQL Server stored procedures
Oracle 12c & 19c experience, including ability to write, edit and debug Oracle PL/SQL packages & functions
MS SQL Server 2017 & Azure SQL experience a plus


Required tasks:
Analyze target customer environments, identify potential migration obstacles, devise migration plan
Modify/update existing migration packages so that Oracle schema is successfully migrated to SQL Server and data imported without error (1 to 2 times per year. In tandem w/ our software release cycle)
Remotely work with DBA counterparts at customer sites on scripting that can be used on both the Oracle and SQL Server sides to eliminate migration errors


Local, Onsite Candidates Only.  Company is located in Peabody, MA.

Looking for a technical expert in Google Tag Manager who can work with events, triggers via css selectors and so on.  The work is to configure GTM to fire some GA events on certain button clicks and other elements of the user experience and to help with some GA configuration around enhanced ecommerce, goals/funnels and so on.  

The project is perhaps 2 days work, likely less.  You can be remote or in Boston and work whenever you want (as long it gets done by a certain date). You will get expert business side input and very specific guidance as needed. 

The only thing I ask is that you have deep knowledge of GTM, GA, and supporting Javascript versus trying to learn it for this gig or very general knowledge about this stuff.  Ideally you have a CS degree or hands on experience configuring GTM and GA (maybe at your day job and want some quick, easy cash moonlighting).

QR Code Link to This Post




Want to join a company that is changing the way cities work and providing clean-water solutions to their residents?

Our client, a technology company focused on monitoring and control of stormwater infrastructure, is seeking a full-time Software Engineer to join their R&D team in Boston.

We are seeking a focused contributor who values the challenge of working on customer-visible issues and possesses the mindfulness needed to help them prioritize, devise, and build general solutions to common customer pain points. This person will play a critical role in the company’s journey to enable the broader community of stormwater practitioners to implement their technology.

They are a small, multidisciplinary team of engineers working to invent and implement the next generation of internet-of-things-based, real-time environmental management. They uniquely combine data describing the actual state of the environment with weather forecasts to actively manage water storage infrastructure, increasing its effectiveness and helping keep water resources clean. To make this all happen, the R&D team builds, operates, and maintains a set of cloud services and embedded devices. As a small team, every engineer plays a crucial role in our success.


Experience:

 You have experience developing cloud solutions composed of multiple services on a team that used Git version control. 
 You have a minimum of 1-year professional experience developing with .NET, and can demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of SOLID principles in software development. 
 Browser application development in Typescript. 
 Microsoft Azure cloud platform. 

Bonus:

 Particle.io platform. 
 GIS or spatial data. 
 H&H modeling or computational fluid dynamics. 
 Time-series visualization. 

APPLY HERE

This client is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. They do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

SalonTarget is a leading SaaS provider in the health and beauty industry located near Boston, MA. We are a technology-driven company with extensive experience in our vertical. This advantage has rapidly moved us to the forefront of an industry going through major change.

We are a distributed workforce (work-off site) of self-motivated individuals bringing innovation and creative solutions to our clients.  Our clients rely on our SaaS solution to cover all of their business and marketing needs.

Backend Developer / Full Stack Node.js Developer 


Come join a fast-growing SAAS company and be an essential part of our team. You will help us develop new back-end business intelligence functionality, help with code improvements of our node.js back-end, code benchmarking, and code security review / quality assurance. Data processing is a core function of what we do. You will have the power to take an approved ‘back of napkin’ sketch and develop new functionality – from idea to code deployment to production.

Self-starter with the ability to work independently.
Distributed Workforce – You work from your home offices!

Required: 

•	BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated work experience
•	5+ years hands-on experience developing scalable, customer facing web and backend APIs, applications
•	2+ years Experience of NodeJS and javascript technologies.
•	Experience working with Git
•	Strong understanding of data structures
•	Experience managing databases (MySQL, MS SQL)
•	Experience developing remotely using ssh on servers using vi or emacs.
•	Quality Assurance Experience 
•	United States citizen or permanent resident.
•	Available Online 9am - 5pm eastern time zone 
Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas, whether to other technical peers or non-technical project managers

Additional Skills & Experience a Plus:
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
SaaS development role
Ability to adapt established coding conventions

Benefits: Work full-time remotely.  More benefits available after contract period.

Salary:  Competitive! (From $10,000/month)

compensation: Commensurate with experience.

employment type: full-time
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



Do you enjoy finding creative technical solutions to business problems? Are you adaptable, flexible, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment? If so, you may be the right fit for our expanding Application Solutions Development team.


As a business data analyst, you will use a highly analytical mind-set to triage and analyze data requests, administer and evaluate operations workflows, and help facilitate greater business intelligence user group meetings. As a unified development operations team, our areas of focus include the development and support of proprietary systems, as well as third-party applications. The team is composed of product management; business systems analysis; software quality assurance and automation; development operations; data analysis, data science, and development; release management; cloud platform solution architecture; web development; and UI/UX design.


Key responsibilities

Reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating user needs to create solutions that support overall business strategies
Documenting system requirements; defining scope and objectives
Analyzing system functionality to identify risks and gaps; providing alternative solutions and recommendations
Collecting and triaging data requests from various business units and communicating with technical integration teams
Administration of operations case workflow system
Assessing and updating case rule logic  
Determining size, complexity, and dependencies of a solution by reviewing business rules, use cases, and user stories
Analyzing system data inputs/outputs using Microsoft SQL to advise on system anomalies and assist with requirements definition
Working with business stakeholders to define, prioritize, and draft business requirements; translating business and functional requirements into technical requirements
Converting requirements into various types of models or diagrams, such as process mapping, decision tables, value streams, and data flows
Facilitating business analytics user group meetings and translating business requests to data management
Meeting with subject-matter experts to identify and document data requirements; creating data specifications that drive solution development and implementation
Collaborating on root cause analysis, application of business rules, workflow issues, and internal/external interfaces for system and data impact analysis
Collaborating with data engineers, developers, and QA testers on solution functions; verifying and validating code updates and data fix changes
Working with vendors to implement new systems and/or modify and maintain toolsets

Core strengths

Knowledgeable in all stages of a project life cycle, including planning, analysis, design, development, and testing
Dual business competence and technical expertise
Adaptable, flexible personality; comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Detail-oriented with ability to multitask and meet deadlines
Strong organizational and analytical skills

Additional skills and knowledge

3+ years of experience performing data/systems analysis and subsequent requirement documentation for IT solutions
1+ years of experience working with MS SQL
Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems and participating in defining resolution strategies
Experienced with Team Foundation Server (TFS), Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS), and/or Azure DevOps
Experienced in Agile/Scrum development methodologies
Familiarity with Office 365 applications/Azure platform
Financial services background a plus


Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity? Let's introduce ourselves.


About Commonwealth--and Our Anything but Common® Culture


Commonwealth Financial Network® is the largest privately held Registered Investment Adviser-independent broker/dealer in the U.S., with offices in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California. Since 1979, we've been delivering indispensable service to independent financial professionals so they, in turn, can put their clients first. Our technology, research, resources, and support--plus a variety of affiliation models--deliver what today's independent advisors need to thrive.


That being said, we are a financial services company with a unique mission--one that encompasses purpose, vision, and core values in equal measure. Staying true to these guiding principles is the reason we are recognized so often and by so many for the quality of life we enjoy here. We believe it directly translates to a better experience for everyone: employees, advisors, clients, and our communities.


Creating a supportive culture where everyone can thrive is a mission we take seriously. From professional development to comprehensive benefits, grassroots leadership opportunities, generous bonus and stock option incentive plans, opportunities to unwind and connect, and so much more, Commonwealth is not just a great place to work--it's a place that, for many, feels like home.


Commonwealth Financial Network® is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to a diverse workforce.

I have designed a clinical study testing a drug in a new indication and the database and patient diary needs to be created/stored in a program which is common at many academic medical centers called REDCAP.  It is a fairly intuitive program, anyone who has created an html page can become familiar with, and I have several query instruments that need to be created in the program and it needs to be set up with daily prompts for patients in the study, which is a functionality already built in to the REDCAP database and program.  I would also if possible like to build the pathways - capabilities for data analysis after the study data is entered into the REDCAP database, which I have been told is also quite easy to export the data but I would like to set up this functionality so that several pre-planned analyses can be performed.  If you are familiar with clinical trials, I will need to develop a statistical analysis plan for the data in advance of starting the study, with the pre-specified analysis (primary and secondary) delineated.  I would like to set up the external database if possible to perform these analyses.
